titlestmt.titleproper: World Fairs & International Expositions sheet music collection
Guide to the World Fairs & International Expositions sheet music collection, 1851-1974 M2221
titlestmt.author: Malgorzata Schaefer

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This is a listing of materials rather than a true finding aid.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-09-15 12:43:52 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: World Fairs & International Expositions sheet music collection

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Sheet music relating to World Fairs and Expositions from 1851 - 1984, 131 sheets. There is a detailed catalog provided from the dealer

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: World's fairs and world expositions have been held since 1851, when The Great Exhibition opened in London. Such expositions are generally large international expositions lasting for 3-6 months, and are designed to showcase different nations' achievements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of 131 original pieces of published sheet music celebrating or commemorating specific world's fairs in America and Europe from 1851-1984. Cities represented include Paris, New Orleans, London, New York, and more. Especially represented in the collection are the 1893 Chicago fair, 1904 St. Louis fair, and 1915 and 1939 San Francisco fairs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-pub lish

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], World Fairs & International Expositions sheet music collection (M2221). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California.
